items.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
items.plainText: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

items.text: How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
items.plainText: How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?

items.text: Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
items.plainText: Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?

items.text: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;
items.plainText: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;

items.text: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
items.plainText: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;

items.text: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
items.plainText: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.

items.text: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
items.plainText: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.

items.text: For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:
items.plainText: For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:

items.text: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)
items.plainText: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)

items.text: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
items.plainText: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?

items.text: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?
items.plainText: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?

items.text: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.
items.plainText: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.

items.text: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite's hope shall perish:
items.plainText: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite's hope shall perish:

items.text: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider's web.
items.plainText: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider's web.

items.text: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
items.plainText: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.

items.text: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
items.plainText: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.

items.text: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.
items.plainText: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.

items.text: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
items.plainText: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.

items.text: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.
items.plainText: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.

items.text: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:
items.plainText: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:

items.text: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.
items.plainText: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.

items.text: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
items.plainText: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
